com.poesys.db.dao

Class DirectDaoManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.db.dao.DirectDaoManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDaoManager

    public final class DirectDaoManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDaoManager
    A singleton object that manages data access objects in the system with no caching, implying direct access to a persistent store for all data access.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

      • getInstance

        public static IDaoManager getInstance()
        Get the singleton DAO Manager implemented with no caching
        Returns:
        the DAO Manager

      • getFactory

        public <T extends IDbDto,C extends java.util.Collection<T>> IDaoFactory<T> getFactory(java.lang.String name,
                                                                             java.lang.String subsystem,
                                                                             java.lang.Integer expiration)
        Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
        Get a DAO factory of an appropriate type based on the implementation. A DAO factory is an Abstract Factory that generates various kinds of data-access-related objects relating to DTOs of a particular type.
        Specified by:
        getFactory in interface IDaoManager
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of IDbDto that the factory caches
        C - the type of collection used for inserting the DTOs
        Parameters:
        name - the class name of the object that the DAO processes, used for naming a potential cache of such objects; the name may be null if the system does not cache objects.
        subsystem - the name of the subsystem that contains the class T
        expiration - the time in milliseconds that an object remains cached; 0 means expire immediately, and the default is MAX_INT
        Returns:
        the DAO factory
        See Also:
        IDaoFactory, IDbDto

      • logMetaData

        public void logMetaData()
        Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
        Log the meta data, if there are any, for the data-access scheme. Cache meta data includes any descriptive information likely to be of use in the implemented caching scheme.
        Specified by:
        logMetaData in interface IDaoManager

      • isCached

        public boolean isCached(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: IDaoManager

        Is a class of IDbDto objects (identified by fully qualified class name) cached in memory?

        Note: a distributed caching scheme may cache the objects of the class but not the class, in which case this method returns false, as there is no need for the information. >/p>

        Specified by:
        isCached in interface IDaoManager
        Parameters:
        name - the fully qualified class name
        Returns:
        true if the system caches objects of the class, false if not

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
        Clear the cache of objects specified by a fully qualified class name. This will clear the cache only if the caching scheme has a way to identify the objects of a specific class. If there is no caching, this method does nothing.
        Specified by:
        clearCache in interface IDaoManager
        Parameters:
        name - the fully qualified name of the cached class

      • createCache

        public <T extends IDbDto> IDtoCache<T> createCache(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
        Create a cache of IDbDto objects of class T with a specified name. If the manager is not a caching manager, or if the caching scheme in the implementation does not implement class-specific caching, this method returns null.
        Specified by:
        createCache in interface IDaoManager
        Type Parameters:
        T - the specific class of object contained in the cache
        Parameters:
        name - the fully qualified name of the cached class T
        Returns:
        the new cache of objects of type T or null if the implementation is not a class-caching manager

      • getCache

        public <T extends IDbDto> IDtoCache<? extends IDbDto> getCache(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
        Get the cache for a named class, if such a cache exists.
        Specified by:
        getCache in interface IDaoManager
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of IDbDto cached
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the class
        Returns:
        the cache of IDbDto objects

      • getCachedObject

        public <T extends IDbDto> T getCachedObject(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                   IPrimaryKey key,
                                   int expireTime)
        Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
        Get an object identified by a primary key out of a named cache. The object may be of any type. The cache name is optional for caching systems that do not have separate caches for each class. This method sets the expire time to the amount specified, so that accessed objects stay in the cache.
        Specified by:
        getCachedObject in interface IDaoManager
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object to look up
        Parameters:
        connection - the SQL connection for object queries
        key - the unique identifier of the object you want to retrieve; also contains the cache name for in-memory cache lookup
        expireTime - the milliseconds until the object expires from the cache
        Returns:
        the object

      • getCachedObject

        public <T extends IDbDto> T getCachedObject(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                   IPrimaryKey key)
        Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
        Get an object identified by a primary key out of a named cache. The object may be of any type. The cache name is optional for caching systems that do not have separate caches for each class. This method does not reset the expire time for the object in the cache.
        Specified by:
        getCachedObject in interface IDaoManager
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object to look up
        Parameters:
        connection - the SQL connection for object queries
        key - the unique identifier of the object you want to retrieve; also contains the cache name for in-memory cache lookup
        Returns:
        the object

      • putObjectInCache

        public <T extends IDbDto> void putObjectInCache(java.lang.String cacheName,
                                       int expireTime,
                                       T object)
        Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
        Put an object into a named cache. The object may be of any type. The cache name is optional for caching systems that do not have separate caches for each class. The expire time tells the cache manager to remove the object from the cache after the specified number of milliseconds; 0 means expire the object immediately, MAX_INT will keep it as long as possible. The default value is MAX_INT.
        Specified by:
        putObjectInCache in interface IDaoManager
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object to cache
        Parameters:
        cacheName - the name of the class cache
        expireTime - the milliseconds until the object expires from the cache
        object - the object to cache

      • removeObjectFromCache

        public void removeObjectFromCache(java.lang.String cacheName,
                         IPrimaryKey key)
        Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
        Remove an object specified by a primary key from the object cache. The cacheName will be null if there are no separate caches for different classes.
        Specified by:
        removeObjectFromCache in interface IDaoManager
        Parameters:
        cacheName - the name of the cache from which to remove the object
        key - the unique identifier for the object
